posts.name:
Helen Yu
Helen Yu
posts.content:
What sets leading companies apart in leveraging AI to create value? 

According to's AI Radar report for 2025:
 Three-quarters of executives see AI as a top-three strategic priority for 2025.
 Companies plan to increase their GenAI investments by 60% over the next three years.
 One in three companies plan to spend $25 million or more on AI in 2025.
 Less than 10% of executives expect a decrease in headcount due to AI automation
 AI agents are already being used by 15% of companies, with 67% considering them as a complement to human talent.
 Executives envision AI and humans working side by side, with 64% of them supporting this view.

Leading companies allocate over 80% of their AI investments to reshaping critical functions and inventing new products and services with the following priorities:
 Deploying AI in everyday tasks for 10-20% productivity gains
 Reshaping critical functions to boost efficiency and effectiveness by 30-50%
 Inventing new products and services for long-term competitive advantage
 Focusing on an average of 3.5 AI use cases (compared to 6.1 for others), leading to 2.1 times greater anticipated ROI on AI initiatives
 Setting clear goals and tracking top- and bottom-line impact, although 60% of companies fail to define or monitor financial KPIs related to AI value creation
 Leaders follow the 10-20-70 Principle to create value: 10% Algorithms; 20% Technology; 70% People and processes

What many companies still struggle with:
 Reimagining workflows and driving cultural change
 Hiring AI talent and upskilling their workforce

To maximize AI value creation,
should focus on:
 Breaking through AI's imagination gap
 Targeting and prioritizing AI efforts
 Putting AI at the service of enterprise ambition
 Leading cultural and organizational change
 Preparing for what‚Äôs next in AI

What have you done getting your company ready to close the AI impact gap? Please share.


Want more insights on
and
?
 Subscribe to the
newsletter hereor our YouTube channel here.
posts.commentAdded: Great insights! It‚Äôs clear that AIs true power lies in collaboration with human talent. Excited to see how companies bridge the AI impact gap!

posts.name:
Ian Koniak
Ian Koniak
posts.content:
My #1 goal in life:

Raise my children in a happy, peaceful home.

When I bring home stress from work, it effects everybody.

My kids pick up on my energy and act out.

My wife tenses up.

My negative energy is contagious, even if it‚Äôs unintentional.

On the flip side, when I am grateful, present, and joyful from the daily blessing of being with my family, everything changes.

My wife lights up.

My children laugh and smile.

And I‚Äôm much happier.

Gratitude and presence bring peace to your home.

But this doesn't always come naturally.

We must set our intention and let go of whatever we come home with.

Why is this important?

Because our family deserves it.

If you want peace in your home, your must be peaceful and lead by example.

I know I still have lots of work to do, but this is a goal that I can strive for daily.

Hope you will join me and lead by example.

comments.commentText: couldn't agree more‚Äîpeace starts with us!

posts.commentAdded: What a powerful reminder! Leading by example truly creates a nurturing environment. Here‚Äôs to intentional presence and boundless gratitude! üåü

posts.name:
Sameer Ranjan
Sameer Ranjan
posts.content: I see a $500B investment in AI infrastructure as a massive opportunity for the rise of blue-collar jobs; I believe this move will strategically place many Americans back to work and start running the micro-economy, including shops and better revenue values during long weekends and festivals. This is a capitalist economy 101, where an infusion of money is going to reach a newer segment of society that was economically not very strong in the last few years. It might also lose better interest rates on construction materials, balanced labor costs, and increased consumption of workplace-based health insurance firms. Right now, the future looks symbiotically well for both white-collar and blue-collar jobs.
posts.commentAdded: Absolutely! This investment could transform the job landscape, fostering growth for both blue-collar and white-collar sectors. Exciting times ahead!

posts.name:
Thomas D√ºbendorfer
Thomas D√ºbendorfer
posts.content:
A wake-up call for Europe & Switzerland: US president Donald Trump just cancelled the AI regulations in the US that imposed registration and notification duties on new AI models and announced a new USD 500 billion (!!!) investment in the AI joint venture "Stargate" backed by OpenAI, Oracle, and Softbank. The goal is to create 100,000 new jobs in five years and to win the AI race and the first tranche of USD 100 billion will be invested this year.

Europe's path currently seems to try to eliminate potential AI threats rather than taking advantage of our amazing AI talent and let them build the most elaborate AI systems to solve mankind's complex problems. The biggest danger seems to me losing the AI race and becoming heavily dependent on others to get access to AI services.



Source:

comments.commentText:
It's worrying because it means that some of the smartest people on the planet have managed to convince the political powers that such an insane quantity of money is genuinely going to change the future. Elon Musk before his stupid antics referred to the administration as a "win for civilisation". This means there is institutional grade change on the horizon for just about every business.

I hope it makes people here wake up rather than dip their head. Europe is lucky to have incredibly smart minds to work and to solve the problems. My main worry will be that they will be sucked out of Europe incredibly quickly if they don't feel they can be competitive here and be part of that change.

Currently working on solving an institutional problem myself and was already told bluntly by several that we should be raising in USA immediately.

ah well. the race was already pretty much decided or not? If you look at the investments done by the Big Tech firms I don't think anyone can honestly think Europe could compete here. The reality is that we lost every single tech wave race in the last 30-40 years and that weights too much, not giving us the means to compete with "gleiche Spiesse".

Quo vadis now? Try to: 1) finally face reality and not claim we are still leaders as I can hear all the time, 2) think long-term what should be done, 3) learn from the leaders, 4) give it highest priority and not just a side show

posts.commentAdded: This is a pivotal moment! Europe must harness its AI talent and innovate, not just regulate, to remain competitive on the global stage.

posts.name:
Brian Rollins
Brian Rollins
posts.content:
Have you ever flushed a dollar down the toilet?

Your business is flushing money. 

A customer journey is generally,

1. Awareness
2. Consideration
3. Purchase
4. Support

You‚Äôre lose customers during consideration, and are struggling with support.

Consideration takes follow up and activating pain points.

Follow up is so easy and nobody does it!

You can easily use Ai for follow up and generate revenue rather quickly.

Support is the same way! There‚Äôs a lot of wasted costs in support. Ai rids you of a ton of those costs and keeps focus strictly on supporting.

Ai is not some crazy expensive system that is difficult to implement.

Humans are a crazy expensive system to implement!!

What are the biggest stoppers of using customer facing Ai in your business?

comments.commentText: Brian Rollins, implementing ai strategically in customer touchpoints can significantly optimize costs while enhancing service quality. have you explored specific solutions?

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Embracing AI for customer engagement can truly transform the journey and enhance support while reducing costs. What tools are you considering?
